channel.title: The DDos prevention team - to protect servers from crashers
channel.description:
[center] Note: Keep post like, GL and such, to PM <_< [url=http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php?action=profile;u=171313]aftereffect[/url] and [url=http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php?action=profile;u=146889]I[/url] are putting up a development team to stop server crashers. If you would like to join, we would gladly accept you. This is not for the [i]Average[/i] coder, if your just here to do nothing, and take credit dont even ask to join. Ikiliki, + other mods, this isnt a help thead, and WE WILL NOT help you about server crashers. All spam + flame will reported, and will probably be punished as so. Mods, I ask you, please do not lock this, we are not here to help people being crashed by servers that post
Zomg ive been crashed how do i stop it~??!?!
This is to develop a server base, with hightend securaty. There are no positions but coders. Accomplishments: ( thanks Zandia :P ) Non yet Working on Unique banner ( so sue me i cant spell :P thanks Chem ) Members: aftereffect hippie Aff allstar93 danny555 rspoon zoltanman zilchuary remove_later Khasck Waffles!! Monkey wacko W W E Syrillia PhatScape© Add my MSN mprock3@verizon.net please dont spam me if your not in the project.

item.title: The DDos prevention team - to protect servers from crashers
item.dc:creator: @Java_Is_My_Bitch Java Is My Bitch™
item.description:
@Java_Is_My_Bitch wrote:

On another topic

You do realize that spamming up a command line like that could lag your comp same as a normal ddos? Also so far the one I’m still working is better then that or at least from what i can see.

I can just comment out the lines in server.java, it will still block it, but without me knowing.

Read full topic

item.title: The DDos prevention team - to protect servers from crashers
item.dc:creator: @Java_Is_My_Bitch Java Is My Bitch™
item.description:
@Java_Is_My_Bitch wrote:

[quote=“zilchuary, post:115, topic:150375”]I came up with this

i thought because he puts nulls also onto the server
il a better antinull 100% made by me!

[code]

import java.io.IOException;
import java.net.ServerSocket;

public class Null
{

public Null()
{
}

public void resetserver()
{
    misc.println("shutting down server");
    PlayerHandler.kickAllPlayers = true;
    misc.println("saved all player");
    closeListener();
    runserver();
}

public void runserver()
{
    try
    {
        String run = "runserver.bat";
        String xstr = (new StringBuilder()).append("./").append(run).toString();
        Runtime.getRuntime().exec(xstr);
    }
    catch(IOException ioe)
    {
        ioe.printStackTrace();
    }
}

public void closeListener()
{
    try
    {
        server.shutdownClientHandler = true;
        if(server.clientListener != null)
            server.clientListener.close();
        server.clientListener = null;
    }
    catch(Exception __ex)
    {
        __ex.printStackTrace();
    }
}

}[/code][/quote]

WTF IS THIS?? Antilag???

BTW you guys haven’t done anything, your working on a banner which seems not so important as creating an Anti-DDoS “Thing” For people who cannot figure it out on their own, Its been 6 days for your banner btw.

Read full topic

item.title: The DDos prevention team - to protect servers from crashers
item.dc:creator: @zilchuary zilchuary
item.description:
@zilchuary wrote:

I came up with this

i thought because he puts nulls also onto the server
il a better antinull 100% made by me!

[code]

import java.io.IOException;
import java.net.ServerSocket;

public class Null
{

public Null()
{
}

public void resetserver()
{
    misc.println("shutting down server");
    PlayerHandler.kickAllPlayers = true;
    misc.println("saved all player");
    closeListener();
    runserver();
}

public void runserver()
{
    try
    {
        String run = "runserver.bat";
        String xstr = (new StringBuilder()).append("./").append(run).toString();
        Runtime.getRuntime().exec(xstr);
    }
    catch(IOException ioe)
    {
        ioe.printStackTrace();
    }
}

public void closeListener()
{
    try
    {
        server.shutdownClientHandler = true;
        if(server.clientListener != null)
            server.clientListener.close();
        server.clientListener = null;
    }
    catch(Exception __ex)
    {
        __ex.printStackTrace();
    }
}

}[/code]

Read full topic

item.title: The DDos prevention team - to protect servers from crashers
item.dc:creator: @bakatool bakatool
item.description:
@bakatool wrote:

[quote=“remove_later, post:108, topic:150375”][quote author=Lothy link=topic=205906.msg1815977#msg1815977 date=1192086836]
How about I speak the truth then: This whole idea is shit. You only need to rewrite one portion of the server - the connection accepting part in the Server class. Have it map IPs or hostnames to the number of connections made by that hostname.

When a new connection is made, check if that hostname already has a connection - if they do, increment the Integer that is mapped by the hostname String. If they didn’t already have a connection, add their hostname and 1 to the map.
I’d use a HashMap - check out the java api docs.

Honestly though, this isn’t a 20 man job - it’s a 10 minute fix if you’re lucky; any longer and you don’t belong near a programming langauge.
[/quote]
I agree, though why a HashMap? What would the value be, if it was the hostname, that what is the key?
java.util.ArrayList or most implementations of java.util.List are better.[/quote]

YA i dont understand the idea of matching integers with hostnames/ips when you can just use list.contains

also in rare cases some IP’s connecting don’t have a hostname. I dont think it should matter if you resolve the hostname or not since that takes time could case delays while connecting just do contain for both hostnames OR ip addresses I think its foolproof either way, also dodian v3 has this system if you look in the source even if you get a wrong password like 4 times it starts to reject your connection for a few minutes.

The way dodian has it, is that it has a exception list of all the server status list checkers
otherwise it does

	public static ArrayList<String> connections = new ArrayList<String>();
	public static ArrayList<String> banned = new ArrayList<String>();
connections.add(connectingHost);
							if (checkHost(connectingHost)) {
								misc.println("Connection from "+connectingHost+":"+s.getPort());
								playerHandler.newPlayerClient(s, connectingHost);
							} else {
								misc.println("ClientHandler: Rejected "+connectingHost+":"+s.getPort());
								s.close();
							}
	public boolean checkHost(String host){
		for(String h : banned){
			if(h.equals(host)) return false;
		}
		int num = 0;
		for(String h : connections){
			if(host.equals(h)){
				num++;
			}
		}
		if(num > 5){
			banHost(host, num);
			return false;
		}
		return true;
	}
	public void banHost(String host, int num){
		if(false){
			banned.add(host);
		} else {
			try{
				misc.println("BANNING HOST " + host + " (flooding)");
				openPage("http://dodian.com/ban.php?host=" + host);
				banned.add(host);
				delay = 2000;
				delayUpdate = System.currentTimeMillis() + 60000;
			} catch(Exception e){
				e.printStackTrace();
			}
		}

oh nvm also process method in PlayerHandler has

if(cycle % 10 == 0){
	server.connections.clear();
	//System.out.println("Clearing connections");
}
if(cycle % 500 == 0){
	server.banned.clear();
	System.out.println("Clearing connection bans");
}

Read full topic

item.title: The DDos prevention team - to protect servers from crashers
item.dc:creator: @zoltanman zoltanman
item.description:
@zoltanman wrote:

[quote=“lawl, post:1, topic:150763”][quote author=Zandia link=topic=205906.msg1813220#msg1813220 date=1191948777]

[quote]Acomploshments:
Non yet

Working on
Uniqe banner[/quote]

Accomplishments*

  • Shouldn’t the banner be the last thing use a should be worrying about lol.

I also would join if you had some decent people in the team. Half of them are 12 or are really immature. Only person I know in there who isn’t young, ignorent or immature is zoltanman.
[/quote]
hahaha zoltanman mature, ahaha oh wow[/quote]

Right back at you.

I don’t go around spamming up this place, just because people are younger and do not know alot about java. I’ve only really seen you, and lothy post really constructive comments that help alot. Other people just make fun, simply because they have problems in life that bring them down. So what people do that have ‘those’ problems make fun of others to bring them back up. Kind of like what you guys are going.

Oh yeah, famous IRC quote:

Cheese_Police: I’m may be arrogant, but deffinatly not ignorant.

Made me laugh all day. If you don’t have anything constructive to say in this, don’t post at all.

Read full topic

When a new connection is made, check if that hostname already has a connection - if they do, increment the Integer that is mapped by the hostname String. If they didn’t already have a connection, add their hostname and 1 to the map.
I’d use a HashMap - check out the java api docs.

Honestly though, this isn’t a 20 man job - it’s a 10 minute fix if you’re lucky; any longer and you don’t belong near a programming langauge.[/quote]

item.title: The DDos prevention team - to protect servers from crashers
item.dc:creator: @hippie hippie
item.description:
@hippie wrote:

[quote=“Aff, post:99, topic:150375”][quote author=hippie link=topic=205906.msg1816017#msg1816017 date=1192087706]
Lothy, this is a team to learn how DDosers work, and how to prevent attacks with proper coding. I quite frankly dont care about crashers, they have no effect on me, i dont host a server and i dont play. The soul purpose of this, is to try and teach the comunity how to code their server so it isnt crashed by DDosers. Shit or not, Isnt that what a comunity is about, to come togeather and learn? Most of this comunity will have no idea what you just said.
Why? becuase they dont know Java, and you cant expect them to know it.
Don’t down this project. Atleast were trying to do something, instead of spaming the fourums

Z0mg SYI SYI my server is crashed, mopar sucks, f**k, it this is for loosers[/quote]

20 man job, 100 man job, doesnt matter. My mission atleast, is to teach people. Cant call that shit.

Agreed, this community needs to learn, whether it is Java, or how DDoSers work. :[/quote]

Thanks for agreeing with me Tim.
Gf.

Read full topic
